speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe where exactly you feel this breast mass is located?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's on the outer part of my left breast, just below the armpit. I was doing my usual activities when I first noticed it, and it wasn't there before that."

speaker: Doctor
text: Is the mass painful? Have you noticed any changes in size recently?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's not painful, actually. The only change I've noticed is that it's gotten bigger quite quickly – it's like it's growing in just a few weeks. I'm a bit concerned about it, to be honest."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any other symptoms like nipple discharge or skin changes around the breast? REQUEST TEST: Mammogram

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Breast Examination: No skin changes, nipple retraction, or discharge.

speaker: Doctor
text: Are there any lumps in your armpit or neck? Have you experienced any recent weight loss or fever?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I don't feel anything in my armpit or neck. As for weight loss, I have lost about 3 pounds since I noticed the mass, but I'm not sure if that's related or just the usual fluctuations I experience as a teacher."

speaker: Doctor
text: Do you have a family history of breast cancer or other related conditions? Have you noticed any changes in the skin texture or color around the affected area?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I don't have any family history of breast cancer or any other related conditions that I know of. As for the skin texture and color, I don't notice anything unusual around the mass itself, but I did notice that the skin around the area feels slightly firmer than usual."

speaker: Doctor
text: Do you experience any discomfort when touching the mass or while wearing a bra?

speaker: Patient
text: "When I touch it, it doesn't feel tender or painful, but I do feel like it's a bit more firm than usual. And, actually, I have noticed that it's more noticeable when I'm not wearing a bra – it's almost as if it's more prominent without the support."

speaker: Doctor
text: Do you have any history of breast surgery or radiation therapy to the chest area?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've had a lumpectomy for a benign cyst in my right breast about 10 years ago, but that was a long time ago and it was completely removed. I don't think that's related to this mass, though."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent trauma to your breast area? DIAGNOSIS READY: Breast mass needs further investigation, consider biopsy.
